alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 26 at 3:30PM HST until February 27 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI...NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI...AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large west-northwest swell has begun to gradually subside but remains high enough to sustain advisory level surf along exposed north and west facing shores. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet along the west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
